job_details.Functieomschrijving:
Join us as Intelligent Automation Engineer Intern at our international headquarters in Utrecht, starting in September 2024. In this internship, you will gain insider knowledge about how automation/robotic engineering influences JDE Peet's landscape and business structure, and you will also have the unique experience of coordinating with multiple important stakeholders within our international headquarters.

   Your key activities will be:
     * Monitor robots on daily basis
     * Collaborate with business leaders and obtain clear requirements
     * Draft Process Definition documents
     * Fix issues in robots (using UiPath codeing, AI and Machine learning, GenAI and Natural language processing)
     * Work with AMS team to develop and deploy automations

   Supported by a commendable 4.5 Glassdoor rating and 94% intern recommendation score, we pledge to provide you with a unique learning journey as part of our GIS IT Robotics team, where you'll gain valuable insights into the process of creating and maintaining robots/automations and how this plays an important role in global and international business structures.

   What's in it for you?
     * A monthly internship allowance of €525 (full-time)
     * Travel compensation if you don't have a free public transport card
     * Paid holidays for each internship term
     * Two weeks of remote working anywhere in Europe (EEA)
     * The chance to learn from the best Automation professionals out there!, * Commitment: You are ready to dedicate at least 6 months to this internship, preferably from the 2nd of September to February.
     * Availability: You can join the internship for 3 days per week, including three days in-office and one or two days remotely, ensuring an ideal balance between collaboration and independence.

   As we hope to have piqued your interest, please ensure you also meet the eligibility criteria and academic requirements:
     * Your internship should be included in your study curriculum and directly contribute to your academic results.
     * Your educational institution is willing to sign a collaboration agreement with JDE Peet's and when joining our Research departments, also sign an NDA agreement for internships.
     * You are either an EU(EEA) student residing in the Netherlands during the internship or a Non-EU(EEA) student enrolled and living in the Netherlands during the internship.
job_details.full_text:
Intelligent Automation Engineer Intern

Join us as Intelligent Automation Engineer Intern at our international headquarters in Utrecht, starting in September 2024. In this internship, you will gain insider knowledge about how automation/robotic engineering influences JDE Peet's landscape and business structure, and you will also have the unique experience of coordinating with multiple important stakeholders within our international headquarters.

   Your key activities will be:
     * Monitor robots on daily basis
     * Collaborate with business leaders and obtain clear requirements
     * Draft Process Definition documents
     * Fix issues in robots (using UiPath codeing, AI and Machine learning, GenAI and Natural language processing)
     * Work with AMS team to develop and deploy automations

   Supported by a commendable 4.5 Glassdoor rating and 94% intern recommendation score, we pledge to provide you with a unique learning journey as part of our GIS IT Robotics team, where you'll gain valuable insights into the process of creating and maintaining robots/automations and how this plays an important role in global and international business structures.

   What's in it for you?
     * A monthly internship allowance of €525 (full-time)
     * Travel compensation if you don't have a free public transport card
     * Paid holidays for each internship term
     * Two weeks of remote working anywhere in Europe (EEA)
     * The chance to learn from the best Automation professionals out there!, * Commitment: You are ready to dedicate at least 6 months to this internship, preferably from the 2nd of September to February.
     * Availability: You can join the internship for 3 days per week, including three days in-office and one or two days remotely, ensuring an ideal balance between collaboration and independence.

   As we hope to have piqued your interest, please ensure you also meet the eligibility criteria and academic requirements:
     * Your internship should be included in your study curriculum and directly contribute to your academic results.
     * Your educational institution is willing to sign a collaboration agreement with JDE Peet's and when joining our Research departments, also sign an NDA agreement for internships.
     * You are either an EU(EEA) student residing in the Netherlands during the internship or a Non-EU(EEA) student enrolled and living in the Netherlands during the internship.

profile_classification.rationale: The role focuses on monitoring and fixing existing automation robots, primarily using UiPath, with mentions of AI/ML and GenAI for issue resolution. However, it lacks the core development, fine-tuning, or deployment of advanced AI models characteristic of an ML or GenAI Engineer. The emphasis is more on business process automation and operational support rather than core AI/ML engineering.

job_tasks.justification: Monitoring operational robots is a key aspect of maintaining and overseeing deployed systems, which falls under Operations Engineering.

job_tasks.task: Collaborate with business leaders and obtain clear requirements
job_tasks.justification: This involves understanding business needs and translating them into technical requirements, which is the core of Business Understanding.
Documenting processes and defining requirements for automation directly relates to understanding and articulating business needs.

job_tasks.task: Fix issues in robots (using UiPath codeing, AI and Machine learning, GenAI and Natural language processing)
job_tasks.justification: Fixing issues in existing code and systems, even with AI/ML/GenAI tools, involves software development and debugging skills.

job_tasks.task: Work with AMS team to develop and deploy automations
job_tasks.justification: Collaborating on the development and deployment of automations, especially with an AMS (Application Management Services) team, points towards operational aspects of software and automation lifecycle.

soft_skills.skill: gain valuable insights into the process of creating and maintaining robots/automations
learn from the best Automation professionals out there!
